elements.title: February Azure (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Russian artist Igor Grabar dug a trench in snow to paint February Azure (pictured)?

elements.title: House of Frankenstein (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that actor Glenn Strange was unaware that he was being called to play Frankenstein's monster in House of Frankenstein until he reported to the make-up room?

elements.title: Nisn Pups (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when journalist and trade unionist Nisn Pups was released from jail, the Communist Party of Lithuania instructed him to change his name?

elements.title: Weywot (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that scientists initially could not determine which direction Weywot was orbiting?

elements.title: Samuel Dexter Lecompte (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Samuel Dexter Lecompte, the pro-slavery chief justice of Kansas Territory before the Civil War, administered oaths to the Fugitive Slave Act instead of the United States Constitution?

elements.title: transgender people in Finland (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that records of transgender people in Finland stretch back to the 19th century?

elements.title: Hold on Tight! (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that crew members had to sign non-disclosure agreements to stop them revealing that the Inside No. 9 episode "Hold on Tight!" was fake?

elements.title: Bob Harrington (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that evangelist Bob Harrington would drive miles out of his way to avoid the sight of a steeple?
